dialogues.text: Chuck opens the window, climbs inside, finds the bed with the suitcase and the briefcase on the springs on top. A l parrot is on its perch in the its cage in the corner.  Ch opens the briefcase to reveal the twin PLASTER MONKEYS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The monkeys of indeterminate  sentimental value took on a new  sentimental value for Chuck. If she  couldn't keep her Aunts, she was  going to keep them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She HEARS footsteps coming up the stairs. She pulls the  monkeys out of the briefcase.

dialogues.speaker: UPSTAIRS LANDING
dialogues.text: Lily walks up the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK'S BEDROOM
dialogues.text: Chuck snaps the briefcase shut and moves toward the windo She stops and takes a look around and slips outside. Lily ENTERS narrowly missing Chuck. Lily crosses to the w and pulls it shut, yanking the curtains closed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chuck stands on the ledge out of sight, the two plaster  monkeys under her arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lily moves to the bed and picks up the briefcase. Behind  her, silhouetted in the door, a MAN quietly ENTERS the ro The parrot SQUAWKS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Oh, for Pete's sake."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lily turns around and FWIP - a bag is thrown violently ov her head. She sucks air and it shrink-wraps to her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chuck is trying to see through the window, but can't arou the winding maze of NEWSPAPER STACKS. She shimmies along ledge toward another window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ned, Emerson and Vivian in the living room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlotte always wanted to get away.   Got away further than any of us  thought.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ned reaches over and holds Lily's hand...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a rare moment of sensitivity, the  Pie-Maker reached out and touched  someone... who didn't want to be  touched.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...but she stiffens at his touch. They sit there an awkwa beat as if a social taboo has been broken. Ned is finally unable to take it anymore and gets up to excuse himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll go see if she needs any help  bringing it down in case it's heavy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ned climbs the stairs to the second landing. It's eerily  quiet upstairs. He takes a few steps down the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Want me to carry that for you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He rounds the corner and sees the stainless steel briefca in the middle of the hall when FWIP - a bag is thrown  violently over his head, as well. He sucks air and it  shrinkwraps to his face. Ned's struggles with the Killer, who tightens his grip, pulling Ned off his feet. WHAP -- Chuck comes out of nowhere and SLAMS THE STAINLES STEAL BRIEFASE upside the Plastic Sack Killer's head. It  rings in his ears and ours. He drops Ned with a plop. He  scrambles back pulling the sack off his face, gasping for air. The Plastic Sack Killer spins around just as Chuck i taking another swing with the briefcase -- THWAP. The Plastic Sack Killer catches the briefcase befo it hits his head, snapping it out of Chuck's hands. A ten beat then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't I kill you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can hold my breath for a long time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Plastic Sack Killer turns to see Lily, still alive,  standing at the other end of the hall cocking a shotgun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 18 years of under-water ballet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, for Pete's sake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BLAM! The shotgun KICK PROPELS Lily backward into the  partially closed door behind her and into the next room. The impact of the SHOTGUN BLAST knocks the Plastic Sack K off his feet and THROUGH THE WINDOW BEHIND HIM, the stain steel briefcase clamors to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emerson and Vivian both react to the commotion upstairs.

dialogues.speaker: UPSTAIRS LANDING
dialogues.text: Chuck and Ned stand with the gaping window between them,  staring at each other. Holy shit. Did that just happen? They look down the other end of the hall where Lily is st directly at not only Ned but more importantly Chuck, her  dead niece evidently returned from the grave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The jig appeared to be up. Aunt Lily  was looking directly at her niece.  Her niece who wasn't supposed to be  alive.

dialogues.speaker: HALL
dialogues.text: The corridor is partially obscured by her eye patch and s doesn't see Chuck at all, only Ned

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And if she possessed two good eyes,  she would have seen her.

dialogues.speaker: ON CHUCK
dialogues.text: She slinks around the corner and out the open window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chuck emerges from the second story and climbs down the r trellis. She turns back to see:

dialogues.speaker: SECOND STORY WINDOW
dialogues.text: Ned's looking out the window at Chuck. The wail of approa sirens can be heard in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: YARD
dialogues.text: Chuck runs across the yard and stops at the dead Plastic  Sack Killer and kicks him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A rush of warmth washed over the Pie  Maker, he would later describe this  feeling as delight. The girl he  rescued from death had returned the  favor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ned turns from the window to find Lily holding the stainl steel briefcase as Emerson and Vivian come up the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: ON BRIEFCASE
dialogues.text: The lid pops open to REVEAL there are no monkeys, but ins it's filled with HONEYCOMB. A single bee flies out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And she gave a little sweetness to  the ones she left behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ned, Emerson, Vivian and Lily watch the lone bee fly out window and into the night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POLICE and NEWS VANS parked in the street outside the fen POLICE OFFICERS, REPORTERS and CAMERA-MEN storm through t gait and stop short at an unusual sight.

dialogues.speaker: THE DEAD PLASTIC SACK KILLER
dialogues.text: He's laying sprawled out surrounded by broken glass.

dialogues.speaker: ON LILY AND VIVIAN
dialogues.text: They step out onto the porch, surveying the REPORTERS and gathering CROWD OF LOOKILOOS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And saw that the Darling Mermaid  Darlings had another go at the teat  of stardom.

dialogues.speaker: ON CHUCK
dialogues.text: She's wearing scarf and long-coat, watching from the gath CROWD OF LOOKILOOS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. Aren't those the world-renowned  Darling Mermaid Darlings?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Reporters glance at Chuck, then back at Lily and Vivi then swarm to the Darling Mermaid Darlings in a CACOPHONO MURMUR OF QUESTIONS and GASPS. Chuck smiles, pleased with herself...

dialogues.speaker: ON A TELEVISION
dialogues.text: Newscaster #1, seen earlier, reports breaking news:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Former "Darling Mermaid Darlings"  Vivian and Lily Charles defeated a  deadly home invader who may have  some connection to the murder of  their niece, "Lonely Tourist"  Charlotte Charles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA PULLS BACK TO REVEAL we are --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA CONTINUES PULLING BACK TO REVEAL Olive again sitti in her over-stuffed lounge chair, Digby squeezed in next her. They're watching the evening news.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When asked about a "Darling Mermaid  Darlings" reunion the sisters  mentioned a benefit performance to  support "Honey for the Homeless" was  in the works.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Olive raises the television remote and we...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA FINDS Ned and Chuck seated at a booth enjoying pie

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, this whole thing is sort  of like reincarnation but more  immediate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sort of.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you believe in reincarnation? If  I wouldn't have come back this way,  would I have come back some other  way?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't wanna believe in  reincarnation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The planet's falling apart. Right  now it's the children's problem, but  if we reincarnate it's our problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never thought of it that way. (considers) Was this an act of kindness? Me.   Here.  Were you trying to do something  good for no other reason than to  help me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shakes his head) I was being selfish. I'd love to  tell myself I was being unselfish  but I know deep down in my primal  sweet spot I was being unselfish for  selfish reasons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you want a corpse bride?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I just thought the world would  be a better place if you were still  in it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The most romantic things she's ever heard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything else I should know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Pie Maker wanted to tell Chuck  about that fateful afternoon when he  brought his mother back and  inadvertently killed her father, but  instead he said...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know everything there is to know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He lied.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She slides one of the Monkeys across the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I figure since they cost me my life  I should get to keep at least one.  And since I wouldn't be alive if it  weren't for you, you should have the  other one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's like those heart pendants that  BFF's wear. Except with monkeys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for bringing me back to life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The word "life" hangs there. Chuck stares at Ned a moment The attraction is palpable, but is it love or fascination Not even Chuck could tell you. Ned's affection is clearer

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for returning the favor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chuck takes her Monkey and presses its face against Ned's Monkey. Ned smiles returning the kiss with his Monkey. He feels the weight of the plaster statue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These are kinda heavy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then: SMASH. Chuck smashes her Monkey against Ned's. The  plaster shatters revealing SOLID GOLD MONKEYS underneath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-huh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The flowers in the yard are blooming and there's a fresh  coat of paint being applied to the house. Lily and Vivian emerge and walk down the path to the gate, stepping out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a renewed interest in the world  on the other side of their fence,  Vivian and Lily retreated from their  retreat...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A large metal water tank with port hole windows in the si Vivian and Lily in robes and wearing bathing caps climb t stairs to the platform above the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and took the plunge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The VERY AMPLE CROWD APPLAUDS as Vivian and Lily DIVE!

dialogues.speaker: CAMERA PUSHES INTO THE PORTHOLE WINDOW
dialogues.text: SPLOOSH-SPLOOSH. Vivian and Lily dive in and into each ot The porthole the window in a kitchen door. The door swing open to REVEAL we are:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA PUSHES PAST Emerson to find Ned and Chuck standing either side of the door to the WALK-IN FREEZER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the Pie-Maker and Chuck took a  plunge of their own...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA PUSHES BETWEEN Ned and Chuck to REVEAL they're sta over a FROZEN CORPSE. A clean-cut white professorial type his late 40's wearing a suit. His name is MARTIN MILTENBE and he's been stabbed several times.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The facts were these: one Martin  Miltenberger, Principal of the Beales  School for Boys was found stabbed to  death in the school's walk-in freezer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Ned's about to touch dead Martin Miltenberger... CAMER JUMPS TO AN EXTREME-EXTREME-EXTREME CLOSE UP and we see t FAMILIAR POP OF ELECTRICITY. Ned sets the alarm on his wa A CLOCK appears in the corner of the SCREEN and begins  counting down from ONE MINUTE. 59 seconds... 58... 57... Martin Miltenberger sits up and takes in his stabbed stat

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But before Principal Miltenberger  could get into the specifics of his  demise, Chuck thought it would be  nice to ask...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have any last words or thoughts  or requests?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ned reacts, glancing at Chuck and loving her for asking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was something the Pie Maker never  thought or cared enough to ask until  Chuck back into his life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You better ask who killed him first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Martin Miltenberger prattles on, Ned stares at Chuck, heart swelling. He reaches behind him and holds his hands behind his back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he stared at her, he reached around  and held his hand behind his back,  pretending he was holding hers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chuck winks at Ned and reaches behind her back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And at that very moment she was  pretending to be holding his.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OFF Chuck and Ned holding their hands behind their backs.
